lines.text: Look at me, Jennie. You can see me if you try. You can see me in your mind. I can free your soul, Jennie. I can take you from the blackness into the light. Look at me , Jennie. Can you see me now?
lines.character: Count Dracula, posing as Bellac Gordal

lines.text: Death. I have come to bring you Death.
lines.character: Count Dracula, posing as Bellac Gordal

lines.text: I think you know. I think you remember.
lines.character: Count Dracula, posing as Bellac Gordal

lines.text: They've found out about Jennie. They're waiting for her.
O yes? Well let them find her. She has fulfilled her purpose. We shall never be touched. The world shall spin and they all, all shall die. But not we.
lines.character: Count Dracula, posing as Bellac Gordal

lines.text: You only fear the unknown. Only this casing, this clumsy flesh stands between you and me. You are already balanced between two worlds. Eternity awaits you now.
lines.character: Count Dracula, posing as Bellac Gordal

lines.text: It is a known fact that there existed in Central Europe a Count Dracula. Though human in appearance and cultured in manner, he was in truth a thing undead... a force of evil... a vampire. Feeding on the blood of innocent people, he turned them into his own kind, thus spreading his evil dominion ever wider. The attempts to find and destroy this evil were never proven fully successful, and so the search continues to this very day.
